title: Dwarvish bearded axe
data:
| )                |                                                         |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name             | Dwarvish bearded axe                                    |
| Appearance       | Dwarvish bearded axe                                    |
| Damage vs. small | 1d8                                                     |
| Damage vs. large | 1d10                                                    |
| To-hit bonus     | +0                                                      |
| Weapon skill     | [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe")                                  |
| Size             | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")             |
| Base price       | 25 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight           | [70](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material         | [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")                               |

A **dwarvish bearded axe** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a one-handed weapon that uses the [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe") skill. Its base [object material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(EvilHack\) "Object materials (EvilHack)") is [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and it appears as a **broad bearded axe** when unidentified.

The dwarvish bearded axe is the [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") for the [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") [Dramborleg](/wiki/Dramborleg "Dramborleg").

## Generation

[Dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") and [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") that would start each game with a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") instead receive a dwarvish bearded axe.

Live [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster_attribute\) "Dwarf (monster attribute)") have an effective 1⁄20 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a dwarvish bearded axe. Dwarven [lieutenants](/wiki/Lieutenant "Lieutenant") have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with a dwarvish bearded axe; dwarven [captains](/wiki/Captain "Captain"), [watch captains](/wiki/Watch_captain "Watch captain"), and [prison guards](/wiki/Prison_guard "Prison guard") have a 3⁄4 chance of being generated with a dwarvish bearded axe.

A dwarvish bearded axe can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining an axe and a [dwarvish short sword](/wiki/Dwarvish_short_sword "Dwarvish short sword").

## Description

While wielding a dwarvish bearded axe, [you](/wiki/You "You") or a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") can [apply](/wiki/Apply "Apply") the axe to disarm a target, similar to the [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip").

## Strategy

The dwarvish bearded axe's damage output is comparable to that of a standard long sword - combined with its ability to disarm opponents, this makes it far superior to the standard axe at the 'cost' of 10 more [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum") before material adjustments. Bearded axes are a solid option for roles that are either restricted in the long sword skill or else seeking a bit more variance in their builds: melee roles such as the [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian") that can reach Skilled or better in axes will appreciate a valuable early weapon. Bearded axes of light material such as [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril") also make good [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") candidates for the primary slot, as well as a solid off-hand weapon once you reach Basic level.

Dwarvish bearded axe

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Name Dwarvish bearded axe
Appearance Dwarvish bearded axe
Damage vs. small 1d8
Damage vs. large 1d10
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill axe
Size one-handed
Base price 25 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 70
Material iron

A dwarvish bearded axe is a type of weapon that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. It is a one-handed weapon that uses the axe skill. Its base object material is iron, and it appears as a broad bearded axe when unidentified.

The dwarvish bearded axe is the base item for the artifact weapon Dramborleg.

Generation

Dwarven Knights and Valkyries that would start each game with a long sword instead receive a dwarvish bearded axe.

Live dwarves have an effective 1⁄20 chance of being generated with a dwarvish bearded axe. Dwarven lieutenants have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with a dwarvish bearded axe; dwarven captains, watch captains, and prison guards have a 3⁄4 chance of being generated with a dwarvish bearded axe.

A dwarvish bearded axe can be created at a forge by combining an axe and a dwarvish short sword.

Description

While wielding a dwarvish bearded axe, you or a monster can apply the axe to disarm a target, similar to the bullwhip.

Strategy

The dwarvish bearded axe's damage output is comparable to that of a standard long sword - combined with its ability to disarm opponents, this makes it far superior to the standard axe at the 'cost' of 10 more aum before material adjustments. Bearded axes are a solid option for roles that are either restricted in the long sword skill or else seeking a bit more variance in their builds: melee roles such as the Barbarian that can reach Skilled or better in axes will appreciate a valuable early weapon. Bearded axes of light material such as mithril also make good twoweaponing candidates for the primary slot, as well as a solid off-hand weapon once you reach Basic level.

A '''dwarvish bearded axe''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a one-handed weapon that uses the [[axe]] skill. Its base [[Object materials (EvilHack)|object material]] is [[iron]], and it appears as a '''broad bearded axe''' when unidentified.

The dwarvish bearded axe is the [[base item]] for the [[artifact weapon]] [[Dramborleg]].

==Generation==
[[Dwarf (starting race)|Dwarven]] [[Knight]]s and [[Valkyrie]]s that would start each game with a [[long sword]] instead receive a dwarvish bearded axe.

Live [[Dwarf (monster attribute)|dwarves]] have an effective {{frac|20}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a dwarvish bearded axe. Dwarven [[lieutenant]]s have a {{frac|2}} chance of being generated with a dwarvish bearded axe; dwarven [[captain]]s, [[watch captain]]s, and [[prison guard]]s have a {{frac|3|4}} chance of being generated with a dwarvish bearded axe.

A dwarvish bearded axe can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining an axe and a [[dwarvish short sword]].

==Description==
While wielding a dwarvish bearded axe, [[you]] or a [[monster]] can [[apply]] the axe to disarm a target, similar to the [[bullwhip]].

==Strategy==
The dwarvish bearded axe's damage output is comparable to that of a standard long sword - combined with its ability to disarm opponents, this makes it far superior to the standard axe at the 'cost' of 10 more [[aum]] before material adjustments. Bearded axes are a solid option for roles that are either restricted in the long sword skill or else seeking a bit more variance in their builds: melee roles such as the [[Barbarian]] that can reach Skilled or better in axes will appreciate a valuable early weapon. Bearded axes of light material such as [[mithril]] also make good [[twoweapon]]ing candidates for the primary slot, as well as a solid off-hand weapon once you reach Basic level.
